bot_dialog: In every country, the government makes important rules and helps people work together. Can you think of any rule made by a government?
suggested_activities: Watch a video where each sound in 'government' is spoken clearly and slowly: [ɡ], [ʌ], [v], [ər], [n], [m], [ə], [n], [t].
Use magnetic letters to arrange 'government' and say each sound as you connect them together.
Listen to a song that repeats the sounds 'ɡ' and 'ʌ' then slowly introduce the other sounds one by one.
Record yourself saying each sound in 'government' separately, listen and practice until you are comfortable saying them.
Descibe a picture of a government building, pronouncing the word 'government' focusing on each sound carefully.
follow_ups: What do you remember most after watching the video about the word 'government'?
Can you show me which letters you used to make the word 'government'?
How does the song help you remember the sounds in 'government'?
What did you notice when you listened to your recording of 'government'? Did you like any specific part?
Do you remember any details about the government building picture we talked about?
